intro: Sturmia ramosa, commonly known as the ramose sturmia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is native to regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in dry, rocky environments. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. Its leaves are typically trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets. Sturmia ramosa is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along rocky outcrops, where it plays a minor role in local ecosystems.
